member.name: T:OVSSerializer.OVSXmlAttributeAttribute
member.summary:
Writes an attribute to the containing class or struct instead of making its own element. Only primitive types can apply, and field must be not an object to apply.
If is on the same field, it will be overrided by
member.remarks: In the code, these are parsed first instead of the elements later listed in the object.

member.name: T:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig
member.summary: The configuration for s.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.CurrentCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture, which will handle primitive printing. Set as for cross-compatibility between computers, but can be set to other cultures if needed.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.UseSingleInstanceInsteadOfMultiple
member.summary: Whenever a reference type is made, and multiple things use the same instance of the reference type, then it will simply use an ID system to refer to said instance. Disabling this removes this feature. Disabled by default.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.Version
member.summary: The current version of the XML file. Null if you don't want any attributes assigned to the root element

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.IgnoreUndefinedValues
member.summary: If the object is set to on the reader, or missing entirely, it will instead allow the default to be set instead on enabled. Where leaving it disabled to set it to instead.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.CustomSerializers
member.summary: A list that overrides the traditional field system, sometimes for readability. Uses as default.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.OmitAutoGenerationComment
member.summary: Disables the use of the comment about being auto-generated by OVSXmlSerializer. Enabled by default.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.VersionLeniency
member.summary: When reading a file, it will check the version. This setting will determine the leniancy that it has to allow parsing it.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.NewLineOnAttributes
member.summary: Whenever it should add a new line when declaring attributes.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.OmitXmlDelcaration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to omit an XML declaration. The declaration mentions the beginning element, that typically mentions the encoding type and the version of the XML.
member.returns: to omit the XML declaration; otherwise, . Default is , as it is autogenerated and most likely be handled by the again.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.IndentChars
member.summary: The single indentation that should occur. This will be repeated as layers are added further.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.Indent
member.summary: When writing onto a file, if it should have indentation such as '\n'.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.StandaloneDeclaration
member.summary:
When writing the XML Declaration, there is a value that tells if the XML document is standalone, which is 'no' or by most documents. In order to be , or 'yes', it has to pass the following conditions:
No default attribute values are specified for elements
No entity references used in the instance document are defined
No attribute values need to be normalized
No elements contain ignorable white space.
There is more information about this here: http://www.cafeconleche.org/books/effectivexml/chapters/01.html, but feel free to leave this as , as this is the default setting for or and serialization.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.TypeHandling
member.summary: how the XML file from should handle types.

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.HandleReadonlyFields
member.summary: How the writer should handle readonly field. as default. This can be manipulated when concerning coding in restricted environment.when it throws a

member.name: P:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding of the result of the file.

member.name: M:OVSSerializer.OVSConfig.AsWriterSettings
member.summary: Converts all data from the config to the relevant writer settings.

member.name: T:OVSSerializer.IncludeTypes
member.summary: The condition of how the should handle types of objects.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.IncludeTypes.IgnoreTypes
member.summary: It will ignore the derived type entirely.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.IncludeTypes.SmartTypes
member.summary: When the object is derived off the field, then it will write the object type.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.IncludeTypes.AlwaysIncludeTypes
member.summary: The XML file will always write the type of the object.

member.name: T:OVSSerializer.ReadonlyFieldHandle
member.summary: How it should handle readonly fields.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.ReadonlyFieldHandle.Ignore
member.summary: Ignores the readonly field entirely.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.ReadonlyFieldHandle.Continue
member.summary: Allows the parser to continue serializing the field.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.ReadonlyFieldHandle.ThrowError
member.summary: Throws an error if a readonly field is encountered.

member.summary: Checks if it can first parse the item, then attempts to write it into the document given the parameters.
member.typeparam: The root object type, can sometimes be just and is made to fill the credentials of .
member.param: The source writer. Mostly used to continue parsing as normal for things like enumerables.
The parent of the current node.
The object to serialize. May sometimes be a .
The name to write as the element or attribute.
The given XmlNode. Note that you still need to write to the , this is for niche internals.
member.returns: If it can actually parse the item.

member.remarks: Note when you create a reference type, please add them in the writer dictionary.
member.typeparam: The root object type, can sometimes be just and is made to fill the credentials of .
member.param: The source reader. Mostly used to continue parsing as normal for things like enumerables.
The suspected type of the object.
The node where which it came from.
member.returns: If it can actually parse the item.

member.name: T:OVSSerializer.Versioning
member.summary: Measures Xml files to check if they are a specific version or not.

member.summary: The attribute's name for finding the version on the document.

member.name: T:OVSSerializer.Versioning.Leniency
member.summary: Measurement on how should handle variation changes

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.Versioning.Leniency.Strict
member.summary: If the values are not exactly the same, then it will return false

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.Versioning.Leniency.Revisions
member.summary: Only revisions are allowed, which is typically considered as security updates.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.Versioning.Leniency.Builds
member.summary: Only revisions and builds are allowed, which would be changes such as bug fixes

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.Versioning.Leniency.Minor
member.summary: Only things that consider backwards compatibility are allowed, which are simple feature addons.

member.name: F:OVSSerializer.Versioning.Leniency.All
member.summary: Even majors are acceptable, so this is a 'use-all' case with the rare exception of null Versions.

member.summary: Checks the version of the XML file.

member.name: M:OVSSerializer.IO.OSDirectory.GetFileIncremental(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates and finds an empty slot based on , adding _{index} between the extension and the name itself (or just adding it normally if it doesn't have an extension).

member.returns: A file info that doesn't exist (yet).

member.returns: The new directory that hopefully contains the same contents.

member.summary: Instead of writing automatically, this allows you to have more control over saving the object.

member.summary: If the value should be serialized at all. Roughly similar to

member.summary: Reads the data of the existing node.

member.summary: Writes the content of class or struct. Use in order to create attributes or elements.
member.remarks: The element is already generated for you, so no need to start or end an element.
member.param: A non-parent node to store the custom data.
